name: (2-amino-3,5-dimethylphenyl)(phenyl)methanol
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2762
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base with a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius. The methoxyphenoxy group introduces additional rigidity and van der Waals forces, raising the melting point by about +20 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group introduces additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The amino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces additional molecular weight and volume, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The dimethyl group introduces additional molecular weight and volume, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The carbamate group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The effects are additive.
